summary: Bolton Wanderers, based in Greater Manchester, England, is a professional soccer club playing in League One, the third tier of English football. Founded in 1874, they've had many ups and downs, including winning the FA Cup three times in the 1920s. The team has played at different levels, sometimes being relegated and then promoted again. They've also reached the Premier League multiple times but have mostly played in the top flight without winning the championship. Their home stadium is the Toughsheet Community Stadium, having moved from Burnden Park in 1997.
title: Bolton Wanderers F.C.
